TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MediaPlayer extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

Docs.summary: Provides media playback for drawings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although you can declare an instance of this class in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot load and play its media without using code. To play media in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] only, use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>. Also, if you declare an instance in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the only practical use is to fill property element syntax for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing.Player%2A> property.
When distributing media with your application, you cannot use a media file as a project resource. In your project file, you must instead set the media type to `Content` and set `CopyToOutputDirectory` to `PreserveNewest` or `Always`.
MediaPlayer can be used in two different modes, depending on what is driving the player: independent mode or clock mode. In independent mode, the MediaPlayer is analogous to an image and the media opened through the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Open%2A> method drives playback. In Clock mode, the MediaPlayer can be thought of as a target for an animation, and thus it will have corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock> entries in the Timing tree which controls playback. For more information on media modes, see the [Multimedia Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
MediaPlayer is different from a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement> in that it is not a control that can be added directly to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] of an application. To display media loaded using MediaPlayer, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext> must be used.
## Examples [How to: Play Media using a VideoDrawing](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the balance between the left and right speaker volumes.
Docs.value: The ratio of volume across the left and right speakers in a range between -1 and 1. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of -1 represents 100% of the left side speakers and 1 represents 100% of the right side speakers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when buffering has finished.
Gets the percentage of buffering completed for streaming content.
Docs.value: The percentage of buffering completed for streaming content represented in a value between 0 and 1.

Docs.summary: Occurs when buffering has started.
Gets a value indicating whether the media can be paused.
Docs.value: true if the media can be paused; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the associated with the to be played.
Docs.value: The clock associated with the to be played. The default is null.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property tells the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer> to be clock driven and will utilize the timing engine, placing the player in Clock mode. Any media that is playing is stopped and the <xref:System.Uri> associated with the new clock is opened.
When the player is in clock mode, seeking using <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Position%2A> or calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Play%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Pause%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Stop%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. These operations are only available when the player Clock is null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void CloneCore(class System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable) cil managed

Docs.summary: Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified . When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void CloneCurrentValueCore(class System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable) cil managed

Docs.summary: Makes this instance a modifiable deep copy of the specified using current property values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValueCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes the underlying media.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer> can be opened again by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Open%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance.
Gets the percentage of download progress for content located at a remote server.
Docs.value: The percentage of download progress for content located at a remote server represented by a value between 0 and 1. The default is 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void GetAsFrozenCore(class System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to clone and freeze.
Docs.summary: Makes this instance a clone of the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values. Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicating whether the media has audio output.
Docs.value: true if the media has audio output; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the media has video output.
Docs.value: true if the media has video output; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the media is buffering.
Docs.value: true if the media is buffering; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the media is muted.
Docs.value: true if the media is muted; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the media has finished playback.
Occurs when an error is encountered
Occurs when the media is opened.
Gets the natural duration of the media.
Docs.value: The natural duration of the media. The default is <xref:System.Windows.Duration.Automatic%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks NaturalDuration cannot be determined until after <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.MediaOpened> has occurred.

Docs.summary: Gets the pixel height of the video.
Docs.value: The pixel height of the video.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Null is returned if the media type is audio.

Docs.summary: Gets the pixel width of the video.
Docs.value: The pixel width of the video.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Null is returned if the media type is audio.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Open(class System.Uri source) cil managed

Docs.summary: Opens the given <xref:System.Uri> for media playback.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Pause() cil managed

Docs.summary: Pauses media playback.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling Pause when a player has an associated <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Clock%2A> will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. Pause cannot be called while the timing engine drives media playback.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Play() cil managed

Docs.summary: Plays media from the current <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Position%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling Play when a player has an associated <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Clock%2A> will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. Play cannot be called while the timing engine drives media playback.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current position of the media.
Docs.value: The current position of the media.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the player has an associated , setting Position will throw an . Position cannot be set while the timing engine drives media playback. ## XAML Text Usage Not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ReadPreamble() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ensures that the MediaPlayer is being accessed from a valid thread.
Occurs when a script command has been encountered within the media.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scrubbing is enabled.
Gets the media <xref:System.Uri>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Source is read-only. This property gets the <xref:System.Uri> that is opened through the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Open%2A> method or the <xref:System.Uri> associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Clock%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of speed that media is played at.
Docs.value: The ratio of speed that media is played back represented by a value between 0 and the largest double value. The default is 1.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Values less than one yield slower than normal playback while values greater than one yields faster than normal playback. If the player has an associated , setting SpeedRatio is not allowed. SpeedRatio cannot be set while the timing engine drives media playback. Audio playback is not guaranteed when is not `1`. ## XAML Text Usage Not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Stop() cil managed

Docs.summary: Stops media playback.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling Stop when a player has an associated <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Clock%2A> will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. Stop cannot be called while the timing engine drives media playback.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the media's volume.
Docs.value: The media's volume represented on a linear scale between 0 and 1. The default is 0.5.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage Not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void WritePreamble() cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the MediaPlayer is not frozen and that it is being accessed from a valid threading context.
